alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Frost Advisory issued March 07 at 2:23AM PST until March 07 at 8:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 34 will result in frost formation. For the Wind Advisory, north winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph expected. * WHERE...San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire. The strongest winds are expected near and below the Cajon Pass. The coldest temperatures are expected in southern and eastern portions of the Inland Empire. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, until 8 AM PST this morning. For the Wind Advisory, from 6 AM this morning to 6 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire
